label: ARV (After-Repair Value) estimated
placeholder_behavior: Not allowed – ARV must be provided to run analysis.
why_it_matters: ARV drives the projected resale value after rehab, anchoring offer calculations.

label: ARV supported by recent comps or appraisal
placeholder_behavior: Allowed – but missing comps downgrade confidence grade.
why_it_matters: Having up-to-date comparable sales or a BPO/Appraisal justifies the ARV and boosts confidence.

label: As-Is Value (AIV) estimated
placeholder_behavior: Allowed – engine can apply defaults (e.g. AIV ≈ ARV if not given), but this can trigger caps on offers.
why_it_matters: AIV represents the current market value. It’s critical for as-is or quick sale scenarios and caps excessive offers.

label: Repair costs estimated
placeholder_behavior: Allowed – a default/placeholder repair cost can be used, but it lowers confidence if not evidence-backed.
why_it_matters: Repair costs impact profit and offer price. A placeholder guess without evidence makes the offer riskier.

label: Repair scope evidenced (photos/bids)
placeholder_behavior: Allowed – analysis can assume standard repair quality, but confidence grade drops for large rehabs without proof.
why_it_matters: Bids, photos or inspections validate the repair budget. Big rehabs without evidence increase uncertainty.

label: Senior payoff amount provided
placeholder_behavior: Allowed – if unknown, engine assumes $0 which can misstate profit (not recommended beyond triage).
why_it_matters: Outstanding mortgage payoff is subtracted from proceeds. An unknown payoff can invalidate the offer math.

label: Payoff letter obtained for senior debt
placeholder_behavior: Not allowed for ready – missing letter keeps deal in Needs Info (engine will flag infoNeeded).
why_it_matters: A payoff letter or statement confirms the exact mortgage payoff. Without it, net proceeds are uncertain and the deal isn’t secure.

label: All junior liens & arrears disclosed
placeholder_behavior: Allowed for math – engine assumes zero if not provided, but this triggers risk flags (placeholder assumption).
why_it_matters: Hidden junior liens or tax/HOA arrears can wipe out profit. All known secondary debts must be accounted for to safely present an offer.

label: Preliminary title check completed
placeholder_behavior: Allowed – if not done, engine assumes no title issues, but confidence is lower and risk gates may watch for undiscovered issues.
why_it_matters: A title search reveals liens or ownership issues. Skipping this could mean surprise costs or deal failure post-offer.

label: Closing timeline set and feasible
placeholder_behavior: Allowed – defaults to policy standard (e.g. 30 days) if not provided, but may misalign carry cost.
why_it_matters: A target closing date or days-to-money drives holding costs and strategy. Without it, the system must assume a timeline, risking miscalculation.

label: No foreclosure/approval deadlines at risk
placeholder_behavior: N/A – applies only if property is at auction or requires board approval.
why_it_matters: If an auction or board approval is looming, the closing timeline must accommodate it. Deals about to foreclose or awaiting condo board ok cannot proceed without plan.

label: Carry cost inputs provided or defaulted
placeholder_behavior: Allowed – engine uses policy defaults (e.g. avg taxes/insurance) if missing, with minimal impact on gating if within normal range.
why_it_matters: Accurate monthly taxes, insurance, HOA, etc. ensure holding cost calculations are precise. Defaults are used if missing, but custom values improve accuracy.

label: Profit spread meets minimum requirement
placeholder_behavior: N/A – derived from outputs; if this fails, the deal is not ready (unless override).
why_it_matters: The deal’s profit margin (spread) must meet the minimum policy threshold. A too-thin spread indicates inadequate profit for the risk taken.

label: No negative cash at close (Cash Gate pass)
placeholder_behavior: N/A – derived from outputs; engine flags if cash would be needed to close.
why_it_matters: If the deal would require bringing cash to closing (negative net proceeds), it fails the cash gate. Such deals are not offer-ready without special approval.

label: Offer within Floor & Ceiling constraints
placeholder_behavior: N/A – derived from outputs; engine ensures MAO is clamped to these limits.
why_it_matters: The Maximum Allowed Offer must respect the investor’s minimum price (Floor) and not exceed the end-buyer’s max (Ceiling/AIV cap). Deals violating these guardrails are adjusted or not feasible.

label: No Risk Gate failures (all critical risks cleared)
placeholder_behavior: N/A – risk gates computed from outputs; any Fail status blocks Ready unless override.
why_it_matters: Critical risk factors (title issues, flood, legal barriers, etc.) must be resolved or explicitly overridden. A failed risk gate means the deal is not safe to proceed.

label: Risk watch items mitigated or documented
placeholder_behavior: N/A – appears only if any risk gates are in Watch status.
why_it_matters: Non-fatal risk flags (e.g. moderate issues) should be addressed or noted. While they don’t block the offer, unmitigated watch items could become problems later.

label: Condo/COOP docs reviewed (SIRS/warrantability)
placeholder_behavior: N/A – only relevant for condo/co-op deals.
why_it_matters: Condo-specific risks like structural reports (SIRS) and warrantability can derail deals or financing. These must be vetted for condo properties.

label: Flood zone mitigated (elevation or insurance)
placeholder_behavior: N/A – only relevant if property is in a flood zone.
why_it_matters: Flood zone properties require extra due diligence (elevation certificate, flood insurance). Without mitigation, flood risk can be a deal-killer or require adjusting offer.

label: FIRPTA (foreign seller tax) handled
placeholder_behavior: N/A – only relevant if seller is foreign (FIRPTA applies).
why_it_matters: Foreign sellers trigger FIRPTA tax withholding. If the seller is non-resident, ensure tax implications are accounted for so there are no net proceed surprises.

label: SCRA (active duty protections) not blocking
placeholder_behavior: N/A – only relevant if occupant/seller is active duty military.
why_it_matters: Active duty military status can impede eviction or foreclosure timing under SCRA. Deals involving protected parties need special handling or timeline adjustments.

label: No active bankruptcy hindering sale
placeholder_behavior: N/A – only relevant if property owner is in bankruptcy proceedings.
why_it_matters: If the owner is in bankruptcy, court approvals or delays may apply. A deal cannot proceed normally unless the bankruptcy is handled (which policy must allow or reflect).

label: Any PACE or solar liens addressed
placeholder_behavior: N/A – only relevant if PACE/solar liens exist.
why_it_matters: PACE (energy/solar) liens can be sizable and senior to mortgages. They must be identified and either assumed or cleared; otherwise, the offer may be way off.

label: Confidence grade meets policy minimum
placeholder_behavior: N/A – computed from evidence completeness; placeholders or stale data usually drop grade.
why_it_matters: The overall confidence in the analysis must be high enough (e.g. B or better by default) to proceed. This grade synthesizes evidence gaps and uncertainty – a low grade signals the deal isn’t ready.

label: Analysis saved with policy snapshot
placeholder_behavior: N/A – relates to process, not an input field.
why_it_matters: The latest analysis run must be saved (persisted) with its policy snapshot and hash in the system. This ensures auditability and that the offer decision is backed by a recorded deterministic output.
